Text.content:
JSPs in OpenCms are not intended to be called directly, as in the example above. JSPs are used in the background as templates to render all the web pages of a site.

For example, http://localhost/template/foo/ or http://localhost/template/foo/bar/ might be web pages providing different content but both are using the same template JSP in the background giving the pages a uniform layout.

The next three steps show how to configure a web site that uses the above Hello JSP whenever a web page is called:

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
Open the Modules app from the Quick launch menu.

Use the wand icon to create a new module.

Type in org.opencms.examples.template as the package name.

If you like, type in a module name and a module description. Leave the rest as is for now.

After the module is created, save the above Hello JSP in the newly created module under /system/modules/org.opencms.examples.template/templates/basic.jsp

Section.Caption: Step 2: Create a new web site

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
Open the Launchpad from the Quick launch menu, and in the launchpad select the Websites app.

Use the wand icon to create a new website.

Type in the following data:

Title: Examples
Server URL: http://example/
Encryption: No SSL encryption
Template: /system/modules/org.opencms.examples.template/templates/basic.jsp

Leave the rest as is for now.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
Open the Sitemap editor from the Quick launch menu.

Click on the Select view menu and choose the Templates view.

In the templates view, create a new page template.

Go back to the Sitemap view.

Add some pages to your site by clicking on the wand icon an by dragging the newly created page template into the sitemap.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
At this point, all configurations for a basic template is there.

In order to check that the template is working as expected, open the follwing pages in the browser:

  • http://localhost/template/foo/
  • http://localhost/template/foo/bar/

Which ever page is choosen, the output of the Hello JSP template is shown.
